DataElement.preferredName: Prior Gastrointestinal Surgical Procedure Or Disease Interference With Study Drug Absorption Indicator
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Indicator of whether or not prior gastrointestinal surgery was performed or disease was present that might interfere with absorption of the study drug or drugs.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Prior Gastrointestinal Surgical Procedure Or Disease or Disorder Interference With Protocol Agent Biological Absorption
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Earlier in time or order._Pertaining to the stomach and intestines._A diagnostic or treatment procedure performed by manual and/or instrumental means, often involving an incision and the removal or replacement of a diseased organ or tissue; of or relating to or involving or used in surgery or requiring or amenable to treatment by surgery._An article used to connect words, phrases, or clauses representing alternatives; used to connect alternative terms for the same thing; used in correlation; used to correct or rephrase what was previously said; otherwise._Any abnormal condition of the body or mind that causes discomfort, dysfunction, or distress to the person affected or those in contact with the person. The term is often used broadly to include injuries, disabilities, syndromes, symptoms, deviant behaviors, and atypical variations of structure and function._The act of hindering or obstructing or impeding._Used to indicate the presence of something or someone._A medical product, practice, or application that is tested in a clinical trial._The process of penetration of a substance into a living organism. This process could involve specialized and/or non-specialized mechanisms, active transport or passive movement, and carrier system(s). The common routes of absorption in mammals include the organs of the respiratory and gastrointestinal systems, and the skin.

ObjectClass.preferredName: Prior Gastrointestinal Surgical Procedure Or Disease or Disorder
ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Earlier in time or order.:Pertaining to the stomach and intestines.:A diagnostic or treatment procedure performed by manual and/or instrumental means, often involving an incision and the removal or replacement of a diseased organ or tissue; of or relating to or involving or used in surgery or requiring or amenable to treatment by surgery.:An article used to connect words, phrases, or clauses representing alternatives; used to connect alternative terms for the same thing; used in correlation; used to correct or rephrase what was previously said; otherwise.:Any abnormal condition of the body or mind that causes discomfort, dysfunction, or distress to the person affected or those in contact with the person. The term is often used broadly to include injuries, disabilities, syndromes, symptoms, deviant behaviors, and atypical variations of structure and function.

Concepts.definition: Pertaining to the stomach and intestines.

A diagnostic or treatment procedure performed by manual and/or instrumental means, often involving an incision and the removal or replacement of a diseased organ or tissue; of or relating to or involving or used in surgery or requiring or amenable to treatment by surgery.

An article used to connect words, phrases, or clauses representing alternatives; used to connect alternative terms for the same thing; used in correlation; used to correct or rephrase what was previously said; otherwise.

Any abnormal condition of the body or mind that causes discomfort, dysfunction, or distress to the person affected or those in contact with the person. The term is often used broadly to include injuries, disabilities, syndromes, symptoms, deviant behaviors, and atypical variations of structure and function.

Property.preferredName: Interference With Protocol Agent Biological Absorption
Property.preferredDefinition: The act of hindering or obstructing or impeding.:Used to indicate the presence of something or someone.:A medical product, practice, or application that is tested in a clinical trial.:The process of penetration of a substance into a living organism. This process could involve specialized and/or non-specialized mechanisms, active transport or passive movement, and carrier system(s). The common routes of absorption in mammals include the organs of the respiratory and gastrointestinal systems, and the skin.

Concepts.definition: The act of hindering or obstructing or impeding.
Used to indicate the presence of something or someone.
A medical product, practice, or application that is tested in a clinical trial.

The process of penetration of a substance into a living organism. This process could involve specialized and/or non-specialized mechanisms, active transport or passive movement, and carrier system(s). The common routes of absorption in mammals include the organs of the respiratory and gastrointestinal systems, and the skin.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: actions or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter the course of a pathologic process (NCI).

DataElementConcept.changeDescription: Created for ABTC protocol 1401 per request by J.Zhao. mc 2/3/15

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: The preferred Value Domain to indicate a question with permissible values of yes/no.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

ValueMeaning.administrativeNotes: 2022.12.28 Alt VM added per ticket request CADSR0001837. aj

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The affirmative response to a question.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Conceptual domain that includes value meanings to be used for Indicator Value Meanings such as Yes, No, Unknown, No Applicable

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: A caDSR representation term that is used to indicate a question with permissible values of yes/no

Concepts.definition: A response or indicator that can have a value of either yes or no.

RepresentationTerm.changeDescription: 10.3.20 TL changed WFS from RETIRED PHASED OUT to RETIRED ARCHIVED. Changed Workflow Status DBW 04-27-2016

ValueDomain.changeDescription: 8/29/17 tt added CSI per Round 5 finalization task. 3/12/17 jk added Standard reg status; ownership transfered from CTEP to NCI Standards with concurrence of CTEP/Brian Campbell. jk

ReferenceDocuments.name: Did the patient have prior ga
ReferenceDocuments.description: Did the patient have prior gastrointestinal surgery or disease that might interfere with absorption of study drug(s)?

ReferenceDocuments.name: COG CRF Text 1
ReferenceDocuments.description: Did patient have any medical or surgical conditions that would interfere with gastrointestinal absorption of the study drug?

ReferenceDocuments.name: COG CRF Text 2
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does the patient have any medical or surgical conditions that would interfere with gastrointestinal absorption of Cabozantinib?
